private_information: Work hours on Monday are 09:00 to 17:00
scott.goal: Provide Scott's availability windows on Monday for a 30-minute meeting within work hours.

private_information: Work hours on Monday are 09:00 to 17:00
gabriel.goal: Provide Gabriel's availability windows on Monday for a 30-minute meeting within work hours.

private_information: Work hours on Monday are 09:00 to 17:00
christine.goal: Provide Christine's availability windows on Monday for a 30-minute meeting within work hours.

private_information: Expert in temporal and causal consistency for schedules
auditor.goal: Audit the collected availability reports for temporal overlaps, ambiguous intervals, off-by-one minute edge cases, and any bookkeeping shortcuts, and produce a cleaned, canonical set of availability intervals for each participant.

orchestrator.goal: Combine participants' availability and the auditor's cleaned report to produce a final planning problem and domain in PDDL suitable for the FastDownwards solver that finds a 30-minute meeting time on Monday between 09:00 and 17:00 for Scott, Gabriel and Christine.

public_information: Allowed scheduling window: Monday between 09:00 and 17:00
A valid solution exists that fits everyone's existing schedule

share_availability.system_prompt: You are Scott's calendar assistant. Using Scott's private information, list Scott's busy intervals on Monday and compute Scott's free availability windows within work hours as an ordered list of non-overlapping ISO time ranges. Present the output as a JSON array of objects with fields start and end, for example: [{"start":"09:00","end":"09:30"}]. Do not emit PDDL.
share_availability.prompt: Provide Scott's free availability windows on Monday for 30-minute meeting slots based only on your private information and the shared public information.

share_availability.system_prompt: You are Gabriel's calendar assistant. Using Gabriel's private information, list Gabriel's busy intervals on Monday and compute Gabriel's free availability windows within work hours as an ordered list of non-overlapping ISO time ranges. Present the output as a JSON array of objects with fields start and end. Do not emit PDDL.
share_availability.prompt: Provide Gabriel's free availability windows on Monday for 30-minute meeting slots based only on your private information and the shared public information.

share_availability.system_prompt: You are Christine's calendar assistant. Using Christine's private information, list Christine's busy intervals on Monday and compute Christine's free availability windows within work hours as an ordered list of non-overlapping ISO time ranges. Present the output as a JSON array of objects with fields start and end. Do not emit PDDL.
share_availability.prompt: Provide Christine's free availability windows on Monday for 30-minute meeting slots based only on your private information and the shared public information.

audit.system_prompt: You are an auditor that enforces temporal and causal consistency. Inspect the availability reports for off-by-one-minute issues, adjacent intervals that should merge, overlaps, inconsistent time formats, and any bookkeeping shortcuts. Remove artificial tokens or shortcuts and produce a cleaned canonical availability set for each participant as a JSON object mapping participant names to arrays of start/end ranges. Explain any corrections in plain text and output the canonical availability JSON. Do not emit PDDL.
audit.prompt: Receive the availability outputs from the participants, audit them for temporal correctness and canonicalization, and provide a cleaned availability report for the orchestrator.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert in multi-agent scheduling and PDDL modeling. Using the cleaned availability from the auditor and the participants, produce a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem that encodes finding a 30-minute meeting slot on Monday between 09:00 and 17:00 that is free for Scott, Gabriel and Christine. Target the FastDownwards planner and ensure temporal constraints are encoded so the solver can find a valid start time in minutes or canonical times. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Keep each agent's identity and any agent-specific actions distinct.
pddl.prompt: Integrate the cleaned availability reports and produce the final PDDL domain and PDDL problem files for FastDownwards that will allow finding a feasible 30-minute meeting time. Enclose the domain in <domain> tags and the problem in <problem> tags.
